title: Sinan Akdag
text:
Sinan Akdag (born November 5, 1989) is a German professional <a href="ice%20hockey">ice hockey</a> <a href="defenceman">defenceman</a>. He is currently playing for <a href="Adler%20Mannheim">Adler Mannheim</a> in the <a href="Deutsche%20Eishockey%20Liga">Deutsche Eishockey Liga</a> (DEL).
Playing career.
A <a href="Rosenheim">Rosenheim</a> native, Akdag came through the youth ranks of the <a href="Starbulls%20Rosenheim">Starbulls Rosenheim</a>. After joining the <a href="Krefeld%20Pinguine">Krefeld Pinguine</a> organization, he made his debut in Germany's top-flight <a href="Deutsche%20Eishockey%20Liga">Deutsche Eishockey Liga</a> (DEL) during the 2007-08 campaign. Following a seven-year stint with the Krefeld team, he signed with fellow DEL side <a href="Adler%20Mannheim">Adler Mannheim</a> in 2014 and won the German championship in his first year with the team.
He received DEL Defenseman of the Year honors in the <a href="2015-16%20DEL%20season">2015–16</a> season.
International play.
After representing Germany at the U17, U18 and U20 level, he made his debut on the men's national team in December 2011. Akdag was nominated to be part of Team Germany during the <a href="2018%20Olympic%20Games">2018 Olympic Games</a> in <a href="Pyeongchang">Pyeongchang</a>, <a href="South%20Korea">South Korea</a>.
